title: Event Frequency Distribution
insights:
Analysis of Bus Ticket Booking App Dataset

The dataset contains a total of 44,031 events recorded from 499 users over the period from December 24, 2025 to January 20, 2026. There are 80 unique event types in the application category.

Dominant Patterns

The following events dominate user interactions:

  • _user: 3,959 events (8.99%)
  • _location_special-town-search: 2,847 events (6.47%)
  • Buslist_date change: 2,806 events (6.37%)
  • _location_elastic-town-search: 2,149 events (4.88%)
  • _bus-search_user-bus-search: 1,592 events (3.62%)
  • _location_from-town: 1,560 events (3.54%)
  • _bus-search_list: 1,478 events (3.36%)
  • _rewards_best-V2: 1,431 events (3.25%)
  • bus_search: 1,429 events (3.25%)
  • bus_result: 1,426 events (3.24%)

This distribution indicates that users primarily engage with search-related functionalities, particularly focusing on location searches and bus listings. The high frequency of the _user event suggests that user identification or session initiation is a key interaction point.

Event Noise

There are no events that appear suspiciously often, indicating no clear logging bugs. However, events with very low counts (< 10) were not explicitly identified in the summary, suggesting that there may be features that are underused or potentially broken. Further investigation into events with low counts is recommended.

Power Users

The analysis of user engagement reveals the following statistics:

  • Median event count: 56
  • P90 event count: 148
  • P99 event count: 720
  • Maximum event count: 1,921
  • Users above 200 events: 34

Power users (P90+) exhibit significantly higher engagement compared to casual users, with P90 users averaging 148 events compared to the median of 56. This indicates a strong engagement ceiling and suggests that a small segment of users is highly invested in the app.

Consolidation

Upon reviewing the event names, there are several events related to bus searching and location that could potentially be consolidated:

  • _location_special-town-search and _location_elastic-town-search may be redundant.
  • _bus-search_user-bus-search and bus_search could be merged for clarity.

Consolidating these events could simplify the event tracking and provide clearer insights into user behavior.
